result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean A Gleason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or any family members.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

To be determined.
AMENDED 09-06-2017:  Court orders restitution set at zero ($0).

Cover letter dated 10/17/17 filing motion to motion to modify sentence by Atty Ek.

10/18/17 - Court clerk left message for Atty Ek to schedule motion.
Defendant's motion to modify sentence filed by Atty Ek.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sean A Gleason in court, in custody (OTP'd from DCI), with attorney Jeffrey John Ek.  

Ms. Nicole Dubois (financee of the victim that is out wedding deposits) is requesting restitution in the amount of $7,003.00.
Defense is contesting that Ms. Dubois qualifies as a victim.

State presented arguments that Ms. Dubois does qualify under statute as a victim.
Atty. Ek presented arguments to the court.

Court finds that Ms. Dubois doesn't meet any of the statutory criteria that define a victim. 
Court also finds that Ms. Dubois doesn't qualify under the restitution statute.
Reasons placed on the record.
Therefore, Court denies any restitution as it pertains to Ms. Dubois.
Court Sets Restitution at $0.00
An Amended JOC to be prepared.

Defendant to be returned to DCI - FORTHWITH.

Restitution hearing on September 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sean A Gleason in court with attorney Jeffrey John Ek. 

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim's fiance presented a statement to the court.
Victim presented a statement to the court via video - (DA's office to provide in DVD format (as a victim impact statement) for the court record).
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's Grandfather presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's Aunt presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
Court remands the defendant to the Custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint or any family members.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

1 Year DL Revocation/Suspension.

RESTITUTION:  Held Open Pending Restitution Hearing. Set for Restitution Hearing.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defense requests a stay pending appeal.
Court denies the request for stay pending appeal.

Defendant to be OTP'd for the next court date.
Defendant to be produced by:  09/04/17.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI - Forthwith.  
Restitution hearing scheduled for September 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing on July 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Court Trial - Day Two.
Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sean A Gleason in court with attorney Jeffrey John Ek.  

Oral Ruling:
Court finds the following:  
Court finds the defendant did not intend to hit the victim or cause injury - Not an intentional act.
However, Court finds the State has met their burden proof - All elements have been proven.
Therefore, Court finds the Defendant Guilty of the charge.
Further reasons placed on the record.

Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be filed by:  07/07/17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
